name: Olumo Rock
address: Olumo Rock, Kuto, Abeokuta, Ogun State, Nigeria
description: Olumo Rock is a historical site and a great place to explore. It was once used as a fortress by the Egba people during the 19th century. You can hike to the top of the rock for panoramic views of Abeokuta or take an elevator for easy access.

name: Oja-Oba Market (King's Market)
address: Oja-Oba Market, Abeokuta, Ogun State, Nigeria
description: A busy local market offering everything from fresh produce to crafts and textiles. It’s perfect for experiencing the hustle and bustle of daily life in Abeokuta.

name: June 12 Cultural Center
address: June 12 Cultural Center, Abeokuta, Ogun State, Nigeria
description: A cultural center offering performances, exhibitions, and festivals showcasing the local art and culture. It’s the perfect place to enjoy live music, theater, and more.

name: National Museum of Colonial History
address: National Museum, Oke-Ilewo, Abeokuta, Ogun State, Nigeria
description: A museum dedicated to Nigeria’s colonial history, showcasing historical artifacts from the period. It’s an insightful stop for anyone interested in Nigerian history.

name: Abeokuta Golf Course
address: Abeokuta Golf Course, Ake, Abeokuta, Ogun State, Nigeria
description: This beautiful golf course offers a relaxing environment for golf lovers. It’s surrounded by nature and provides a peaceful setting to enjoy a round of golf.

name: Ake Palace
cost: Free entry for the exterior; fee for specific tours
description: Ake Palace is the residence of the Alake of Egbaland. Although you can’t always tour the palace itself, the area is rich with culture and history.

name: Itoku Market
description: Famous for its Aso-ebi (traditional fabrics) and local crafts, Itoku Market is a great place to shop for souvenirs and authentic Nigerian fashion.

name: Oke-Ilewo Park
description: A serene park in Abeokuta where you can relax, have a picnic, or enjoy a quiet day outdoors with friends and family.

name: Bilikisu Sungbo Shrine
description: A historic site dedicated to the legendary Queen Bilikisu Sungbo. The shrine is located in a peaceful area surrounded by nature, offering a spiritual experience tied to local folklore.

name: Abeokuta Wildlife Park
address: Abeokuta Wildlife Park, Abeokuta, Ogun State, Nigeria
description: A small wildlife park that is home to several species of animals, including monkeys and birds. It’s a family-friendly location where you can learn about wildlife conservation.
